remarks: The supremum of a finite set is greater than or equal to all the elements of the set.  (Contributed by AV, 1-Oct-2019.)
statement:
supgtoreq.1 $e |- ( ph -> R Or A ) $.
supgtoreq.2 $e |- ( ph -> B C_ A ) $.
supgtoreq.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. Fin ) $.
supgtoreq.4 $e |- ( ph -> C e. B ) $.
supgtoreq.5 $e |- ( ph -> S = sup ( B , A , R ) ) $.
supgtoreq $p |- ( ph -> ( C R S \/ C = S ) ) $.
